description: Amazing quality! Especially for the price; which was super reasonable for SF. We got the golden warrior, tango, and salmon avocado. They were all delicious.
author: Derek S.

description:
my friend recommends this place to me. I​ feel like they are a bit short of hand since the waiters are so rush in a Sunday​ afternoon. it's not very welcoming since it's my first time here and being alone. 

But! their sushi definitely​ won my heart. I​ tried the sample menu and was impressed by the tuna belly(not so surprised) and Kuro​ dai. Kuro Dai is a must try! it has such a special aroma​ that I will absolutely come back even just for it.
author: R R.

description:
Hmm....I really hope it is a great sushi restaurant, I should say I wish the sushi was better, since it is near where I live.  Oh well, for the price, I still give it a 3 stars. 
I heard during lunch is better and cheaper. We might be back for lunch but not for dinner.
author: Kent Q.

description:
I cannot express how wonderful my experience was here. The great balls of fire are amazing!!

The sake is wonderful.  The Hamachi collar is great. The uni was ridiculous. The fish was so fresh. I can't wait to come back.
author: Warren M.

description:
Wow! This place is awesome. So I went during santa con, interesting times in the city... Kuma's atmosphere was a nice escape from the noise outside. They have great ambiance, the music selection was great, and the candle lit tables and semi-low lighting was a nice effect.

About the food-while I enjoyed the 4 different rolls I had, I highly recommend trying the "Great Balls of Fire" with  panko breaded tuna and salmon roll, topped with sriracha, spicy mayo, unagi sauce, green onions, tobiko, and our house furikake. This roll is amazing! I had sake as well, which is always a nice touch with sushi.

Do note-there was no sign above or in front of the building when I went there so don't just look for a sign. It's one store away from being right on the corner and has big windows in the front. Great for going on a date as well, that's what I did!
author: Kevin R.

description: Unbelievable! The nigiri sampler is carefully crafted. You even eat it in a certain order. The shochu is unique. And the lidako karaage is amazing. You think it'll basically be calamari but it's actually way better. Can't recommend enough.
author: Evan Z.

description:
I had a sudden craving for sushi and decided to finally give this place a try since I couldn't get last minute reservations to my usual spots; Robin and Hinata. I'm so freakin happy that I gave this place a chance! The fish is so fresh and even more, it's so ridiculously reasonably priced! This for sure will be my new go to sushi spot before attempting to dine some where else.

I arrived around 6-6:30pm on a Sunday night and was able to get seated right away. I think we beat the dinner rush because ~15-30 mins after that, a pretty decent wait started to form.

Nigiris:
- magurozuke (it was alright. I've had way better & would probably not order again)
- sake toro
- umi masu
- masu toro
- vancouver uni
- maine uni
- ikura

Rolls:
- CA roll *REAL CRAB
- spicy tuna
- half baked *REAL CRAB

Menu Items:
- hamachi kama (really good, but could've been grilled better. I would order again though)
- osuimono
- chawanmushi
- Mitchel's be ice cream (biggest scoop I've ever gotten from a restaurant)
author: Annie N.

description: Sooo soooo good! Excellent staff, great atmosphere, and amazing sushi & sashimi. Sat at the bar and was able to watch everything being made! 10/10
author: Kasey C.

description: Good service - great sushi. If you're trolling through yelp looking for a place with amazing sushi but won't set you back several hundred dollars, this is the place. I started with the chef's choice of 4 pieces of nigiri and wasn't disappointed. We then ordered salmon, yellowtail, ocean trout & fluke nigiri. The fish is fresh and buttery and the sushi rice has just enough vinegar in it and is perfectly soft. Lots of sake options if you're into that. We had ube ice cream to finish which was also delicious. If you're looking for casual sushi dinner in SF make this your first option - they seem to fill up fast, even on weekdays.
author: Alice T.

description: I had one of the best meals of my life here last week, sushi or otherwise.  It was absolutely sublime.  It may have also been the costliest meal I've had.  It was worth every penny.  Traveling on business solo on a Wednesday night, I wandered out of my hotel, happened across this place, checked yelp reviews, and chose to try it.  It was quite busy, but being alone I was seated at the sushi bar within 10 minutes.  I opted first for the Chef's Choice sashimi.  It was a piece of art...absolutely gorgeous.  I almost didn't want to ruin it by digging in.  The Japanese Black Sea Bream was a new experience for me.  It has a fantastic texture.  The Chef clearly knew his stuff; it was a perfect combination.  I added some nigiri.  When uni is right, it's really right, and this was an exemplary example of how good it can be.  I chose the more expensive San Diego caught uni and it was worth it.  They had monkfish liver!  I tried that years ago, loved it, and haven't been able to find it since.  Sounds weird, but if you have an adventurous spirit, I recommend trying it.  Finally, the person sitting next to me had Hamachi Kama - broiled japanese yellowtail collar.  It looked amazing, and he said it was extremely good.  Next time I'm in SF, I WILL be back to try that.
author: Andi B.

description: Impressed with the service! Always so quick to take our finished plates and take our orders. Love the vibe of this place. The salmon sashimi were all excellent. The octopus starter was the best, the seaweed was crunchy and had a great texture. The fries with eyes had an amazing umami to it. Would have been five stars if not for the tall chairs being so awkward to sit on, I had to slouch over my food. Also the spicy tuna was mediocre at best.
author: Eindra K.

description:
Best. Sushi. Dinner. Ever. 

Exceptionally memorable were: Osuimono (soup), Sakekawa Arugula (salad), fried amaebi, Great Balls of Fire, and nigiris of Hirame, Sake toro, Marinated tuna, Saba, Ama Ebi & their fried heads. The Mitchell's ice cream of mango/pineapple/tropical paradise fruits was really nice. That may have been everything I ate sans 1 or 2 nigiris.

I question whether the people who didn't have a good time get to taste their sake. It's Kuma Sushi + *Sake*. Have the sake. Or 3. If something's in the restaurant's name, you have to have it for your review to matter. But this is Yelp. What people say here generally don't matter. What I mean is, your $0.02 is worth $0.02 if you've had the sake. Otherwise it's worth -$10000 because you wasted my damn time. Anyway, we intended to have 1 carafe but ended up having 3, on a school night. It's delicious & you can do it. I believe in you. 

We had Toji-Kan, Kikusui, and then Hakuro Suishu. The Hakuro was really delightful. It had hints of apple & yuzu and it was super smooth. Just go from top to bottom of the sake menu; Professionals thought about this for us so we don't have to. It's easier to tell how good something is if you work your way up and it gets noticeably better and better. Like life!

Finally, the details. I really appreciate Kuma's decor, and how it combines Japanese aesthetic and traditional elements in a very lovely way. I also admire their support of local SF artists in their restaurant. The bar corner I sat featured a beautiful Seasonal Seafood Poster by Young America Creative, a local SF artist. Upon entering I also noticed a beautiful live wall with moss & live plants atop the wall of the back of the restaurant that I later learned that it was from a local artist from around the corner! 

The food, the art, the drinks, the decor, and the people -- all of my favorite things. A new friend that I met 3 days ago who sat next to me at Halu recommended Kuma and I was pleasantly blown away. This is a thoughtful place, and the care that was put into the details is remarkable. 

Kuma Sushi + Sake is well deserving of their success thus far & this was the best Wednesday I've had. I'd gladly come back every opportunity I get. I don't have any photos because I had my friend take them so I can eat.
author: Jenny W.

description: Intimate setting interesting rolls. We really liked half baked and hey girl. For the price you pay this is good quality sushi.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Always up for trying a new sushi spot. 

First off- the interior is awesome. Nice wooden paneling and good setup for a small place. That reminds me, it is a small spot with limited tables which fill up quickly, so the earlier you get here, the better. 

Side dishes: Hamachi Ponzu was delicious and nicely balanced. Also the Iidako Karaage (fried baby octopus) was amazing.

Nigiri: Here it was just ok. fish portions relative to rice is average.

Rolls: Had one (sorry forgot which one) which was good but again average. 

Overall: Go for the side dishes vs the sushi. Can't say it stands out from the crowd or worth trekking out to if you are not in the area but its a good attempt.
author: Amy J.

description: Decent sushi bar for small groups. Found this place from friend's recommendation. Nigiri are very fresh compared to other sushi bar at the same price level. Hot sake is tasteful too. My favorites are the sweet shrimp and purple yam ice cream. The only con is that foods were served slowly.
author: Yaqian C.

description: Food was decent but the sushi chef was rude. Bald Asian dude. Didn't seem interested in serving our party. Oh well, tons of sushi in SF
author: Kyle H.

description: Cute neighbourhood spot with yummy sushi. A little pricey. The great balls of fire and sake tasting flight are delightful. Lots of spots close by to grab a casual drink after if you are in to that.
author: Lauren G.

description: Excellent food at a very reasonable price. Don't miss the tempura octopus. Will be back!
author: Malena S.

description: Excellent food, questionable service. Rolls, "great balls of fire", miso soup, purple yam ice cream and sake were of excellent quality, but unfortunately the magic was broken by the rudeness of one of the servers: When we started ordering ice cream he had an attitude, turned around and left (?!) then came back and rudely replied to our request for advice on ice cream flavors. We picked one, he rudely grabbed the menu from our hands, took away a plate with a sauce we were still munching on, and then harshly put the ice cream on our table. We have his picture so please ask via private message if you want to prevent him from ruining your experience. Without this person I would have given four stars to this restaurant.
author: Guillermo G.

description: Chef was amazing with great services and good quality of fish! Definitely will come back
author: Wing c.

description:
Sushi is bomb here! We came in on a Saturday night at about 7:00pm & it was about a thirty minute wait, not too bad. We sat at the bar & ordered quite a lot. 
House sake:  pretty good
Albacore tataki: AMAZING the spices they use are super tasty
Great balls of fire: Boyfriend had it & said it was interesting at first but once you're used to the sauces & flavors it tastes amazing
Negihama: Yummy, good basic roll. Fish was really fresh 
Anago Nigiri: Flavor was strong but good, hadn't had saltwater eel before but it was a good. Might even like it better than freshwater eel 
Overall a good experience, staff is super friendly & happy to talk to everyone.
author: Skylar M.

description: When a place is good and you go back there the next day?!! Yup this is one of them. I first tried it on a Wednesday night and it was pretty busy. Didn't wait long for one person like 15 mins! Everything I got was delicious . Was soooo good I went back the next day! Lol now for a Thursday night it was really busy!!! After being seated at the bar which I recommend. It a great view. I decidedly try something new and it didn't disappoint! Was gonna go here again for the third day in a row but decided to wait lol. So good it's addictive
author: Rho G.

description: The fish is very fresh. It shows the aptitude and technique of the chef of course. We ordered traditional nigiri chef menu and more Americanized roll. Both of them are extremely good. I think the rice is not that excellent comparing to the high quality of the fish, but it's still very good. The price is fair.
author: Jason C.

description:
Well,
I should have read Jennifer L's review lastnight before deciding to eat here.
I live in the neighbourhood and have been craving for some good sushi. 

We usually go to Ryokos, Sanraku, Akiko's, Wayo or amami down in south sf.

Kamu's choice of
"let us entertain you" is pretty poor.

As a respond to a previous reply of a review, wrote that Ryo and him quote " trying to build a casual neighbourhood experience where we truly connect with our guests."

First off. Bare in mind that you are REQUIRED to be seated at the sushi bar if you'd like to try "let us entertain you" on the menu.

A normal assumption is that the chef or at least someone would try and get to have a sense of what you prefer and do entertain you according to your flavour if fish isn't the main course here.
Other wise why should that service be strictly served only by the sushi bar?

1) Ryo was our chef. Standing right in front of us.
We tried making conversation without success since all the chef just seems to be rather disinterest in serving us. (The host was probably the only friendly staff there)
Not once has anyone asked us if we preferred what or if there's anything we like or dislike.

2) well without knowing your customers of course you're not gonna know what they want. Traditional omekase from my experience serves fishes that's fresh or they do accordingly to alternative mix of what the chefs wants to do and how you like it.
They fed us kale salad.
I came to a sushi to have kale... salad hmmmm 
If that was the case I would be in the marina or wholefoods wouldn't I?
it was charged separately from the 8 pieces of fish. 


3) soft shell crab was horrible.
 It came. Well hot but it tasted uncooked. Not talking about the sushi grade sort of uncooked but sort of crewing on dead flesh sort of uncooked. 
Definitely a 2 star. 
Of course it's not included within the "let us entertain you." It cost around 14usd which was not worth the dime. 

4) the fish. It was so-so. Nothing that akiko , ryokos or sanraku can't provide or do better.

My advice.
Save your money and go else where.
Simply by reading others reviews about the friendly staffs, dim lighting and decor.
Wouldn't justify good Japanese food.

Friendly staffs doesn't make the restaurant successful. 
Especially when your service ain't consistent.

I give 2 compare to the 3 Jennifer previously gave since "friendly treatment" was no where to be found on top of the lack of taste there was. 

We walked out with a 120usd bill. 1 beer included.
We ordered a steamed egg as an extra but the rest was all charged separately with the "8 pieces of fish"

The fish was not particularly delicious or outstanding either. 

That's all I have to say. Disappointing.
author: Alui L.

description:
Amazing sushi and service. 
Also a great lunch special. 
The atmosphere is a modern classic vibe. A clean restaurant with welcoming servers. 
Would definitely come back again.
author: Meghan M.

description:
Of all the great choices in San Francisco, we ended up here twice. The first time it was by random chance for lunch when we got in town and the second time it was a late night dinner and it we knew it was good so... round 2!

The hostess was very nice and got us seated quickly both times. Also we ordered a drink while we waited maybe 5 minutes. The service was great both times. Speedy yet not too quick and talkative and friendly. We were remembered on the 2nd trip and welcomed back. 

Trip #1 We sat at the Sushi Bar. We split "Salmon Avocado Roll" and the "Hey Girl". We could tell they were both very fresh and I would recommend them. My girlfriend had a glass of Rose and loved it as I had the Sake Flight (3 glasses) and it was amazing. 

Trip #2 we showed up around 10:00pm and waited maybe 5 minutes before being seated. As stated before, recognized us from the day before. We each had a cup of the Miso Soup and the same drinks (glass of Rose and the Sake Flight). This time we had the "Hey Girl" again as well as the "Fresca Roll". We agreed that the "Fresca Roll" is the best sushi we have ever had. We also had the "Mitchell's Ice Cream" for dessert in both flavors "Ube" and "Cantaloupe" (both were phenomenal!!!). 

I would recommend Kuma Sushi 100%. We had two great meals in two days!
author: Rob P.

description:
Really wanted to love this place cuz I've read amazing reviews. But rice was undercooked and this is simply not acceptable for a sushi place. Enough said. I know this place is not a Michelin star restaurant, but undercooked rice for nigiri is just not ok. 

We went pretty early so there was no wait. Ambience was nice and service wasn't too slow for a new restaurant.

However, I don't think this place is good from the price. The sushi bite that comes in a spoon for $7 (for 2 spoons) is kinda tiny. Quite limited selections of the rolls. 

Unless I heard some crazy good reviews and been convinced by many people, I would not come back to this place. For similar price point, you can have a legit feast at Otoro in Hayes.
author: Ruxin H.

description: The Mimi roll and tomato is very special and super good! Happy that we find this place :D
author: Wen W.

description: Went here to try out the 8-piece nigiri tasting and was not disappointed! Friendly and knowledgeable staff and well-priced menu :). Small spot which may get crowded, so go early!
author: Thalia H.

description: Overpriced mediocre quality sushi + crap service from hipster bros who work here. That about sums up this place. Took 10 mins to get water and tea and another 10 mins for any sort of acknowledgment to order. What a disappointment.
author: Tom T.

description: What a treat. As sushi lovers this is the best sushi I've ever experienced. Very original menu. Looking forward to coming back with my sister and brother-in-law. They'll love it!
author: SJ C.

description: January 13, 2018, My wife and I escaped the Central Valley for the weekend and were craving Sushi.  For obvious reasons we had high expectations that  we would find a great location in San Francisco.  Kuma Sushi did not disappoint.  Very quaint and clean restaurant located not far from Union Square on Polk Street. We enjoyed four of the specialty rolls, and a spicy tuna roll.  Our favorites were the "Half Baked Roll" and the "Hey Girl Roll". Followed closely by the "The Tango Roll" and "Fresca Roll".  Our server was very attentive, friendly, and helpful. I want to apologize to him that I cannot remember his name, he definitely deserves recognition. Fantastic sushi and service at a great price.  I highly recommend eating here!
author: Jacky P.

description:
Walked around aimlessly and stumbled upon Kuma.  We peeked inside and all the tables were full - we had a 5 minute wait.

This is a new place - only opened 3 days ago.  Impressed with the decor (very modern), the menu was good and the price point was very good.

Everything you order from the menu will be very good.  My favorite was the baked crab roll!  

Hot Sake was filled to the top.

For dessert, they had a filipino ice cream flavor - Ube!!!  

One of the owners, Roy (hope i spelled his name right).  came by our table and asked how we were doing, so we got into conversation about the restaurant.  Very nice guy and so are the hosts.  Good music, everything top notch - even the bathroom!

You should try this place out before it gets well known and you'll be standing in line.  It's a great addition to Polk Street.  All the restaurants in that area are old done.  If you want your sushi fix, this is a great place to go.
author: R M.

description: Fresh quality and excellent customer service! This is hands down one of the best sushi spots in the Bay Area, in the heart of SF. This restaurant is quite a hidden gem as not many know about this place...yet. Will be taking advantage of this before it gets way too popular.
author: Jon L.

description:
Happened in during their soft opening, friendly staff quickly seated me at the bar. Ordered my go-to rainbow roll and  then the half baked. Then sashimi. Salmon and trout. 

Everything was beyond good! The half baked tasted incredible, Hot out of the oven and very rich. Rainbow was delicious and the crab had a fresh dry taste, not the overly sauced texture you sometimes get. 

Sashimi was spot on, crisp and incredibly flavorful. I highly recommend!
author: Dustin M.

description:
The atmosphere is so nice and inviting; a simple design with lots of warm wood and shaped cement counters, the cement wall is not plain, but patterned with small metal accents. A large bar area is lovely with plenty of elbow room and tall seats to be able to view the Chefs at work. And the Chefs/Owners are incredibly engaging and fun to be around. Ryo and Cory love what they do and were always willing to answer our questions.

First we started with a tasty, smoky Osuimono soup - a rich, clear fish broth with pieces of mushrooms and sliced soy. The daikon salad was stacked high with arugula, fish flakes and fried salmon skin, and of course, lots of daikon. Then came the Sashimi tasting, chefs choice (photo below) - 5 kinds of fish (2 each) all the fish was yummy but the highlight was the trout belly - so buttery and rich.

While we were deciding they showed us the flown-in box of soft shell crabs from Chesapeake. Of course we had one, fried up and they serve it with finger limes - squeeze and it looks like roe, breaks in your mouth like little lime flavored roe eggs. So delectable. See photos.

The Great Balls of Fire is just fun and gratifying. Panko breaded and deep fried tuna and salmon roll with several awesome sauces. Crunchy goodness.

One of their specialty rolls came up next, The Tango - Salmon, Mango, with a touch of spicy green pepper. Not overly sweet or spicey, just delicious.

Then came the coup de grace - Chawanmushi - egg and gouda and mushroom and crab steamed in the same smokey broth as the soup of our first dish - so good. I would go back for this alone.
author: Andrew U.

description: Tried this during soft launch after passing it on the way home from work. The prices were very reasonable and the quality was amazing. This will be a much better alternative to Elephant Sushi, which is nearby. Highly recommend if you want good sushi and good service.
author: Jessica M.

description: One of the best affordable sushi joints around. The sushi chef Ryo is super friendly and down to earth. The sushi is spectacular, regardless of the price. We managed to come on a quiet night (due to Mayweather vs McGregor fight) and even got some sabisu from Ryo. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Joey L.

description: Seaweeds salad, Salmon collar, yellowtail sashimi, mango roll, pineapple roll all very good. salmon colllar was my top pick!
author: Dan T.

description: Kuma is amazing! We ordered the 8 piece sushi and soft shell crab. The crab was perfectly fried and came with finger limes on the side. The fish is fresh and really good quality - you're definitely getting way more value for the cost. This is going to be my go-to sushi place for when I'm craving sushi but don't want to splurge on an overpriced omakase somewhere else.
author: Youri P.

description:
above average sushi

no self respecting sushi place serves rolls

B+ on the sushi
D- on service

Angry angry service from the beginning. I could go into anecdote after anecdote but why waste my time.

you can be an angry sushi waiter when there are lines out the door and your sushi quality allows you to be a sushi nazi, but not now.
author: joe b.

description:
The hostess was working wonderful.  She didn't seemed phased by a long waiting list. She effortlessly made sure we had drinks while we waited.   
The sashimi was melt in your mouth delicious.   We did the chefs platter and although it only had 10 pieces, those 10 were amazing.  The balls of Fire were also very good but you had to make sure you had ample sauce ( which they had) on each one to make up for the dryness of the balls.  With the sauce, it made an excellent combination.  
We also tried the tasting spoons. The salmon with capers one was OK, nothing I would make a special trip for but the halibut one was delicious.  It had a very light acid component which paired wonderfully.  
We had a problem with our sashimi platter being given to two other tables (a mix up in the checks) but the staff made it right by comping our drinks.
author: suz s.

description:
Overall, this is a solid sushi option in San Francisco! It's a great intersection between quality and price.
There is a wide selection of fish to choose from. We ordered the sashimi special to start and later ordered nigiri to supplement. Everything we ordered tasted fresh and had a very rich taste. 
Here are a few highlights from the many things ordered:
The sashimi omakase style plate for $36 dollars was a great deal! It offered 5 different types of fish. To my surprise they gave a good variety with beautiful presentation.
The umi-masu(ocean trout) was a must have! It had such a unique flavor and was a stand out. It's great for people who like salmon toro but want something different. I'm sad that the masu-toro was sold out. The hotate nigiri(Japanese scallop) was a bit lacking compared to other places in the city (new oyaji and ryokos). It didn't have the same freshness and creamy taste as other places. The otoro was delicious but a bit pricy at $20 for two pieces. Otoro is good if you're really into the rich fatty taste but not a necessary part of the meal imo. Especially since there are other interesting things to try on this menu. I finished the meal with dashimaki tamago (egg with japanese stock) this was ok but it was lacking the umami flavor that is unique to dashi.  
I cannot speak to the rolls at this place as I only ordered sashimi and nigiri. However, the fish is already so good and fresh by it self. It feels like rolls would be waste of the great quality and inherent flavor of the fish.
Finally the bill came. We spent around $115 for 2 people on just food. I left satisfied but not stuffed. For this price point the service could have been better.
The service was a bit slow in general. But that was because they seemed understaffed for a Saturday night with only two waiters. They could use an extra person to help with checks and seating people. Numerous tables were waiting for simple things like checks and they could increase turn around on tables quicker if they had the extra help. On side note, I appreciated them refilling my tea and explaining what was presented on each dish despite them being so busy.
Be sure to call to ask about the wait time. The line can get long around 8pm on the weekends. The place is pretty small and table are cramped. There isn't any privacy between tables so you can basically hear everyone's conversations.
Ideal weekend scenario: Go here for dinner and go for karaoke at Yamasho after!
author: Summer B.

description: Been here twice but it's neither memorable nor bad... I like their furikake edamame, but didn't enjoy their hamachi ponzu because it was seared (I prefer it be raw). Good ambiance!
author: Reiko P.

description: This place is amazing! Came to SF for a night and it was such a refreshing change from some of the sushi joints in South Bay. The service and food was absolutely perfect. The rolls are more unique and obviously a lot of thought is put into the menu. We had delicious chef's choice nigiri and a daily special roll, spicy tuna roll, and half baked. They were all delicious, and the ginger served with it was also yummy. We had some ube ice cream to top it off. So good! Quick, attentive service by one guy running through the place, and great food. Highly recommend and wish I was closer to visit again!
author: Nicole B.

description: Kuma is a true gem. This is the kind of place that we'd all be lucky to have for as long as forever. Being the sushi and sashimi purist that I am (raised on an island that just offered up some of the best world class cuisine, sushi and sashimi that almost jumped out because of its freshness, to tourists who can afford it), I've been on the hunt for something that would come close. Have been unsuccessful, until last night... Wanted sushi and sashimi for my main bday dinner, in spite of celebrating all weekend, having Malaysian in Milpitas, Italian in Newark, and bar eats to round out the first set of celebrations. We decided to make the trek into the city, hoping the yelp reviews didn't steer us wrong with Kuma. No reservations but came before 5:30pm, so was seated at the bar right away. Place is small, intimate, and easily gets loud. Seating is nice but again, small space means not too much elbow room, especially at the bar. Read through the menu while sitting in traffic on the bay bridge, decided on the omakase, chef's choice, $19, which gave 4 generous sized nigiri. We each had 3 rounds each so got to sample 12 of the Uber yummy and fresh fish, escolar, aka Hawaiian butter fish being our absolute best favorite of the entire offering. Uni was beyond fresh - it was sweet, melt in your mouth sea candy that almost made me swoon from the sensory overload. Just that good! We had the baby octopus karaage, hint of spice, tons of crunch, and boatload of flavor. Even though it was fried, it was not greasy or heavy. Very well done. We also had the daikon salad that was served with generous slivers of fish skin chicharon. Light ponzu sauce is worthy of bottling and being sold on its own. Miso soup was flavorful and served piping hot each time - we each had 4 bowls! I know, guilty. I don't drink anything cold with sushi or sashimi, since I was raised to only have hot green tea, hot sake, and hot miso soup, so yes, my tradition lives on :) Each delectable piece of sushi was artfully and (super yummy) tastefully done. Perfect tiny amount of lightly seasoned rice topped with the heavenly pieces of fish and seafood. Each bite transported you to a different level of appreciation and craving for all things good about sushi. I'd be proud to admit  the experience was transcendent. Our chef, Cory, topped off our amazing meal with 2 (gratis) scoops of Mitchell's ube ice cream - simple flavor, straightforward, wonderfully balanced - a perfect way to end the fantastic foodie experience. Not "cheap" or "economical" by any stretch of the imagination, but like they say, you get what you pay for. If you want fresh seafood and to be blown away by their true value, nay, their only value, aka flavor and freshness, Kuma delivers on this by giving you the heavenly experience in a well balanced atmosphere, that's also supporting local farms and seafood sources. Can't wait to go back!
author: Nida A.

description: I was overjoyed to find out that they have gluten-free soy sauce. #celiacsrejoice The sushi was fresh and served quickly.
author: Yvonne L.

description: Exquisite sashimi, great presentation, friendly & helpful service. The chef will gladly answer any questions. Walked in here based on the Yelp rating, and it proved to be absolutely correct.
author: Tim Z.

description:
It was good but nothing blew me away or made me say oh hell yes I'll be back. Rolls were small and simple, pretty much I was still hungry when I left. 
I got the tango roll, kuma roll, some salmon roll with lemon and avocado and a seaweed salad. 

This was simple sushi maybe it's what we ordered but I wasn't impressed and I wasn't full off of $50.

I won't be back, I didn't hate it and I wasn't dissatisfied but I've been to a lot more places that are way better.
author: Maria K.

description: Stumbled across Kuma after a concert (open late!) and were blown away by the quality of the food and the warmth of the service. Let them tell you what's in season and go for it!
author: Noel M.

description: Amazing sushi, knowledgeable staff, and great dinner overall. As a Nyc Sushi snob, I was wowed.
author: Melissa B.

description: This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant in SF. We've taken numerous guests here and we typically don't visit restaurants more than once and we've been here 6 times. The hey girl is my favorite and great balls of fire. The custard thing with crab at the bottom is great. The tasting menu is to die for. We absolutely love this place. The wait is challenging but if you get there right when they open you should be alright.
author: Shanea K.

description: An excellent sushi dinner here with a daily menu of starter plates and fresh fish. An amazing dinner. I highly recommend!
author: Delilah B.

description:
Went today to celebrate my birthday with good friends. The food was great and the sake was so good it was dangerous. The fish is fresh and for the price it is in San Francisco, it's a place I would recommend to others. The staff are really friendly, not overly attentive (not like those who comes every 20 minutes to ask if you are doing okay or if you want to order more). We stayed for awhile, made three different orders, and the last two were small orders. But the staff didn't make us feel like we have to leave right after we finished our food or we need to make decision base on their timeline. It was a very pleasant experience.

Thank you for making my birthday dinner such a good dinner.
author: Emily H.

description: I recently discovered this place and was SO glad I did. When we first walked in it was busy and had a great vibe and energy. We were greeted by a very friendly gentleman who brought us sake while we waited to be seated. Luckily we got to sit at the sushi bar and were able to watch the chefs work! As the dishes were coming out I was more and more impressed. The owners were very knowledgeable and friendly and the sushi was so fresh and tasty! I come to SF once a month for work and this will now be my go to sushi spot whenever I'm in town! Clean atmosphere, fresh fish, great service, and passionate business owners! Definitely recommend!
author: Monique L.

description: OMG Kuma, I heart you. I tend to only order nigiri when I come here, because they are just out of this world. I personally think their nigiri is as good as (if not better than) Shiro Sushi up in Seattle. The wait can be quite long since it's a small restaurant, so be prepared for it.
author: Lindsey O.

description: I had a short yet excellent meal at Kuma. The miso soup was unusually good, the service was quick, and my sushi roll was delicious (I had the Hey Girl with shrimp tempura topped with tuna and spicy mayo). They're doing a lot with a small space, and the ambiance is wonderful. Hard to spot from the outside - but that adds to the fun!
author: May C.

description: Best sushi in SF. I bring friends here all the time and they think the same. Great service and even better atmosphere
author: Stephanie A.

description: This is honestly my favorite sushi restaurant EVER! Great food, very reasonable prices, and a great staff. This is the perfect place if you love sushi as much as I do and also a great place for date night.
author: Asante B.

description:
Good sushi! A tad overpriced on some rolls.
Ordered Edamame, Hey Girl and Mango tango
author: DD P.

description: The food is great-- their specialty rolls especially the great balls on fire, half baked and hey girl are great. Nigiri taste is great: salmon is my fav. One star off because the waiter was very very very impatient and rude. He took away our menus even when we were ordering. Never checked in re: food or drink until we checked out.
author: Zhonghui Z.

description: Roy is the best one! He made the most delicious sushi I ever tried. Also, their sashimi is amazing, try it. Definitely coming up.
author: Olga Z.

description: Excellent quality fish.  The salmon belly and Fresh Hawaiian albacore stood out, and the sweet potato roll was surprisingly tasty.   Great ambiance and friendly service as well.  I highly recommend.
author: Charity F.

description: Awesome sushi! Extremely friendly and great service! The sashimi is beautiful and not super expensive, highly recommend trying this place.
author: Robin A.

description:
I walk in for lunch and take a seat at the bar. Cool breeze comin in the door, light chatter, and a stellar and smooth 90s hip hop playlist bumping throughout. I look at the lunch specials and order a maki combo. Little did I know this also comes with raw kale salad topped with dressing that could make my kitchen towels taste good and a miso soup. Miso soup was solid, no complaints here. Then comes the maki combo. You're gonna want to hear this. 
I am handed a plate:
California roll two ways - one heavy on the cado with a small but powerful piece of crab beneath. Delicious. Other one was like a seafood salad with cado, mostly crab in the salad. Money. Then some fat chunks of spicy tuna piled high with cucumber and the other usual fixings. Absolute fire. Then the shrimp tempura. Shrimp tempura to bring it home. You gotta be kidding me. But these guys don't kid. They don't hit you with a bunch of cucumber and squash rolls when you get the maki combo. They don't throw yesterday's catch along with a bunch of veggies on your plate. None of that. This place is real deal. They leave it vague on the menu, something like "4 rolls, 3 pieces each." So you really never know; it's the lunch combo, a lot of places would screw you and give you very limited raw fish. Not kuma. These guys came to play ball. And as I'm sitting here waiting for the check I remember this whole thing was $15. I'll be back tomorrow, and I would highly recommend.
author: Alex C.

description: My wife and I had a wonderful time here during the Christmas holiday. Service is great for such a busy spot and the food was delicious. This will be our "spot" when we are visiting the City.  We sat at the bar so we went home smelling like tempura, but it was well worth the quality of the fish and creativity on the menu. We'll be back!!
author: Marcelo B.

description: Sushi was Awesome! I would give this place 200 stars! Price was great, service was superb and place was so clean. When I come back, I will definitely be stopping by to try the octopus. I never knew you could add pineapple to sushi!!!
author: Anthony L.

description: Love! Fresh, delicious, budget-friendly, with a very kind and attentive staff. The kale salad and fresh roll were amazing. Thanks, Kuma!
author: Kelly R.

description:
This is food the way it should be done.

They add Wasabi to the Nigiri, as they should. Do not drown the sushi, because it's perfect the way you get it.

Enough said.
author: Anthony B.

description: Hands down the best sushi I've ever had, and not badly priced at all. All the fish was smooth and buttery; I couldn't stop ordering more. Will definitely be going back before I head home again! Well worth it.
author: Alex G.

description: I was incredibly fortunate to stumble upon this place this weekend when the city was usually quiet after the holidays. The sushi was incredible, really high quality and innovative flavors. And the sushi chef was a pleasure to chat with, in addition to providing perfect recommendations to our order, while turning out superlative nigiri. Not to mention the awesome octopus kirage appetizer and sake. Excited to return soon!
author: Valerie Z.

description: 5 stars because the quality of food is excellent, service is quick and the waiters are kind, the ambiance is cute (clean, new, good music), and it's right next to my apartment. I will be here often :)
author: Selina W.

description: called ahead of time and was told 20 min wait for a party of 4. came in and sat there for 40 mins while they continued to sit smaller parties who came in and signed their names on the waitlist way after my family and i did. felt like they didnt want to seat us because i had my 9 year old daughter there. came to me after he cleared the list and said he can split us up into two separate parties, only after he gave away all the four person tables to couples. that was fucked up. either then that, menu is minimal and very tacky. wont recommend to other friends or family.
author: Jordan I.

description: Had a great experience. Sushi was superb and enjoyed all the creativity. The owners were hands on and made the experience unique. Great and unique sake and look forward to returning on my next visit to san Francsico.
author: M M.

description: 5 stars due to their very good prices. My chirashi bowl was $15, and really good service. Their fish was very fresh, their rice was on point and their miso soup was remarkable. Will definitely come back.
author: SaNtiago R.

description: Super tasty! This was one of the best little neighborhood secrets I have ever been to.  Fresh, fresh ,fresh sushi! Everything was so good.  I would recommend the hamachici!
author: Kathleen T.

description: Extremely disappointed. Very poor customer service. My family and I were excited to try this restaurant because of the great write ups. We called ahead for a wait time for a party of 4. We were told 20 to 30 min. The problem was that they only had 2 tables for 4. The rest for 2. After an hour of waiting and watching 5 other couples getting seated ahead of us I asked the waiter. He was completely rude and unhelpful. We left and will never go back.
author: Kourosh M.

description: This place is excellent. The fish is incredibly fresh, the service is great, and the place is clean and cozy. I'll definitely be back.
author: Callie C.

description: It's been so hard to find a true sushi chef since our regular chef passed away a few years ago. Saw the high reviews and decided to give it a try. The reviews sure did not disappoint me and I thought it was very good. Every fish we ordered were so fresh and the chawanmushi was  one of the best I've had here in the states!  It will definitely be our go to place from now on.
author: Mary L.

description: Finally a great sushi place in San Francisco. I've been here for two years and have found some amazing places to eat but never sushi. This place has great service and fresh delicious food. The half baked roll was delicious and the hamachi hand roll was super fresh. Can't wait to go back!
author: Kerry G.

description: This is without a doubt the best sushi I've ever had! Amazing flavors! If you love sushi, you need to eat here!
author: Marisa C.

description: So happy for Ryo, this place is so good! Definitely top of our list for Omakaze in SF.  The fish is always fresh, with a good Sake selection and intimate setting for date night or small group of friends.  Always willing to throw down for my friends who are hustling to make their dreams come true.  Keep it up man!
author: Aaron G.

description: Small location, nice ambiance. However, we waited over half an hour for any food - only one nigiri chef, apparently. Usually places would give some appetizers for poor service like this, but we were just left with water. The more expensive nigiri was pretty good (uni hokkaido, toro, ebi) but didn't like the roll we got (mr.krab), and nothing special about the rest of the nigiri. Would not come back, quite expensive for the experience.
author: Stacy M.

description: This place is BOMB. Great ambiance and the fish was fresh and very well prepared. The appetizers are also delicious and are prepared by a talented chef. Great Sake as well.
author: Jake L.

description: I went here last night and had some of the best sushi I've had in a long time. The menu is creative, all the flavors were bright, and the decor was modern but welcoming. I had the hamachi (excellent) and the rainbow roll (good). I also had a few bites of my partner's spicy tuna roll and found it uniquely flavorful.
author: Charlie S.

description: My go-to is chef's sashimi, however, it was an especially nice selection including toro. The chef was also especially friendly & knowledgeable in general with friendly recommendations. Grab a drink across the street while you wait :)
author: Caroline L.

description: This was the only sushi place I tried while in SF so I can't comment on how it compares locally, but the fish was very fresh and the presentation was great. The prices are very reasonable ($6-12 for rolls) so this would be a staple for me if I had stayed in the city longer.
author: Ryan D.

description: Food is yummy and fresh, service is great, chef is friendly, environment is ambient. I will come back again!
author: Janice S.

description: I work at a high end sushi restaurant in Boston so my taste for good quality sushi needs to be fulfilled often.... and Kuma was exceptional. Very friendly & helpful service, and more importantly the food was phenomenal. Miso soup and seaweed salad were fresh and well prepared. I had the Hey Girl roll and I would HIGHLY recommend it. Shrimp tempura with avocado with raw tuna on top, eel sauce and spicy mayo, it was delicious. So fresh and unique! I will be going back before I leave SF next Wednesday. Thanks again Xo
author: Madison R.

description:
I'd give 5 stars if not for their super super super slow service. The dish tastes really good though, but not good enough to take that long for the whole experience.

You will expect to stand there 5 minutes before seated and another 10-15 minutes to get ordered. After that another 20-25 minutes for the main dish to be served. And the main dish is just sashimi over rice. I didn't have time to wait for the staff give me receipt, so I had to look for him. Probably won't go again for lunch. Basically for each service you need to find the waiter by your own.
author: Xiaochen Z.

description: I really really enjoyed our dinner at Kuma, even though we went on the hottest day ever in SF. The quality was great and the price was even better. About time a place like this opened in SF! The spoons, especially the uni and avocado, were amazing. The sake sampler was also tasty and showcased a range of different sakes. My only gripes are that they let people sit at the bar with a seat left in between parties. This left two single seats which easily could have sat another party (myself included as I always prefer the sushi bar in front of the chefs). Additionally we ordered another set of spoons but never got the order. Fingers crossed that this place stays a secret so the wait isn't too long (they don't take reservations) but I know people will find out about Kuma sooner rather than later. In any event, it's highly recommended!
author: Cathy B.

description: This place is sweet. The setting and decor is on point and makes it to be a great date place as well as a quick sushi bite. The hostess was nice and was prompt with our orders. I've been to others and had orders take long and even times where they forgot our orders, so this is much appreciated. Great place, I'd come back again.
author: Brian P.

description: This is one of the best sushi restaurants I've been to in San Francisco. The place itself is small, but the decor is great and tables/bar seats are well spaced out. The panels behind the sushi bar are really nice but my favorite is the wooden shelf. The food is incredible and staff is extremely welcoming and accommodating. They definitely pay attention to their customers. All the dishes I had were delicious - highly recommend the miso soup, steamed egg dish, Mr. Crabbs roll and basically anything the chef recommends. Will definitely be going back regularly!
author: Pamela V.

description: Had an excellent meal here for their grand opening. Decided to try it on a whim and was not disappointed. Chef is very knowledgeable and staff are very pleasant. No line because it's new. Very fresh sushi with unique roles that I haven't tried elsewhere.
author: Jeremiah K.

description: Amazing sushi and awesome chefs who are friendly and kind! Half baked is awesome and they have a rotating specials menu with seasonal fresh sushi that always dazzles
author: Jay W.

description: Ask for Rio or John. One of the better sushi spots I've gotten to eat at in sf. Great price and excellent quality.
author: will l.

description: I was pregnant and went here and ordered the great balls of fire (they are deep fried). It was sooooo good I ordered another order. My husband had nigiri, and would've liked more of a selection of fish but it was good nonetheless. I'd go back for the great balls of fire any day.
author: Sabi G.

description: Fresh, beautiful plating, amazing service. 5 stars all around. Finally found my favorite sushi spot in San Francisco (nothing comes close to Kuma!). Sake flight is great, highly recommend sitting at the bar. And ORDER EVERYTHING. Enjoi my friends!
author: Andrew C.

description: The best sushi and sake I've had in years. If you're looking for amazing sushi and you want to taste some fantastic sake for lunch or dinner, this is the spot.
author: Dan S.

description: This is the only sushi spot I need for the rest of my sushi eating career. Excellent menu and sake list. service is precise and elegant.
author: Brewbacca W.

description: Awesome sushi place, it's not Nobu but it's reasonably priced and the quality is excellent
author: Felix P.

description: Super mellow sushi place with a nice staff. Would recommend for a local place that's quiet. Will be neck again.
author: Steve A.

description: Stopped here last night for dinner unexpectedly, and I'm really glad I did. I had the Half baked, Great balls of fire, and the Hey Girl. Every dish was incredible! The food came quickly and the staff was very attentive! Definitely coming here again!!
author: Ren L.

description: Fantastic sushi in the neighborhood. The service is great and the sushi is always perfectly fresh and delicious.
author: Natalie C.

description: I like their neat interior and presentation. The Chef is very friendly and the food was delicious. Clean table coordination goes well with their food plate and presentation. I would come again.
author: Eunice P.

description: The atmosphere was bustling with good conversation to accompany great food.  The service was excellent and the selection was phenomenal. Fresh,  delicious,  and memorable.
author: Gloria A.

description: So many reasons to like this place: menu on the door, $16-17 sake sampler (you get to try 3 and there is a solid amount in each glass, so pretty much, 3 drinks), it's not too loud, they are open relatively late, the lighting is good (not to bright, not to dark), the service is excellent, and they have marimo moss pets in their bathroom (as well as a stash of pads ans tampons! Thank you!). Overall, great experience.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Just stopped by for a bit of Sake and was blown away by the attention to detail, freshness of
Seafood and conversation!  Ended up trying 4 incredible dishes. As a chef from this neighborhood I'm so excited to have this spot down the street!
author: Gabe L.

description: Friendly staff and great sushi, especially for the price point.
author: Alexander T.

description: The food was decent but not as good as I had expected.  They added several twists to popular rolls that just made it taste bad.  The salmon avocado roll has a slice of lemon inside (including the lemon rhyme).  That totally ruined the taste.  After removing them it was better.  The fish was fresh.  The staff is super friendly and helpful. I know they are new so hopefully they can work out some of the beginner kinks.
author: Thomas D.

description: we loved Kuma sushi! It was super busy the night we dropped in, but the staff was so accommodating, seated us right away, and encouraged us to try the delicious green tea ice cream which was SOOO good. The meal was so fresh and we had a great time. Will definitely return!
author: Haley D.

description: Went here for Mother's Day lunch. Place looks decent from outside.  Us and another lady couple were the only ones waiting when it opens.  The guy who opened the door (has tattoos) was so rude and that's before we even go inside. I offered to help hold the door and he declined rudely.  Then we happened to stand in his way in putting his standing signs by the door and without asking politely to move out the way he just put the sign.  Then we got in, when we told him there will be party of 8 (5 of us already there), he told us we can't b seated until all arrived.  Mind you there is no one else in the store except the other lady couple.  So we decided to change to just us, and when my mother-in-law started to sit down, he got upset for that.  He said he needed to reset the table.  That was the last straw....on Mother's Day.....we decided to just walk out...and went to moon star and stuffed ourselves. Glad didn't waste my money in that lousy bad customer service place.  Let's see how long this restaurant will survive with that kind of service in this neighborhood!!!
author: D T.

description: Fantastic sushi place, every single choice was amazing! And the service was very friendly and smiley!
author: Dimitra S.

description: Very good sushi, nice sake menu, and friendly service. The rolls were very good (salmon avacado, kuma, fresca, konteki), the sushi was good (magurozuke - a type of tuna). the only dish we were not crazy about was the ponzu. recommend/worth it if there's a wait ...
author: john r.

description: Great quality fish, subpar service. Dishes came out in bizarre order all evening, got my edamame halfway through my meal and the staff completely forgot one of my appetizers admitting that he "gave it to another table" and then proceeded to say "my bad." I think this is a great staple for the neighborhood but tbh I'd rather go to Domo in Hayes. Similar vibe, more fish choices, better service.
author: Cassidy M.

description: The food was amazing- we had the baked crab roll which was the best piece of sushi I have had. Great atmosphere, great saki. The reason I give it 3 stars is the location. After dinner, My friend was assaulted by a man trying to get her purse right to the left of the restaurant on our way out. Go eat here, just please get dropped off right at the door.
author: Nicole B.

description: Came here on a Friday night and was able to be seated at the sushi bar immediately. The fish was very fresh and I opted for the $36 chef's choice. My biggest gripe is about their portion size. The cuts of fish were very thin and small and the flavor was a bit bland for a chef's choice tasting. I expected more continuity in the flavors but the only word to describe the taste was bland. Ikura and uni portions were tiny although the ikura was seasoned very well and "popped" in my mouth
author: Bobby D.

description: The sushi here was pretty good. Fresh. Nothing out of the ordinary and nothing that makes me crave it and want to go back, but it was good. 3.5 stars.
author: Jay H.

description: My boyfriend and I are big fans of Domo sushi in Hayes Valley so when I heard that Kuma opened up I knew we had to give it a try. We happened to dine here during their soft opening so at the time they were still working on smoothing out the final menu. Service was a little slower than expected given the amount of patrons in the restaurant but the food was very comparable to Domo. We tried a variety of items: ebi, tuna, salmon, yellowtail, marinated tuna. All the sashimi was fresh and delicious. Would def recommend Kuma!
author: Kim C.

description: I sat at the bar and had an enjoyable experience at this new neighborhood sushi spot. The sushi chef, Ryo, was a good conversationalist and made me feel very comfortable and welcome despite the fact that they were quite busy.  I ordered the eight piece sushi tasting. At $32, I thought it was good for the price.
author: Tyler H.

description: Fresh delicious sushi, great service! Had the sushi assortment, 8 different pieces that were all beautifully prepared. The rest are magic mushroom roll and hamachi all perfect. Would highly recommend
author: Amy C.

description: Very small place, nicely decorated interior, overpriced sushi and small portions.  Left feeling hungry and with a large bill.  Sushi was decent but nothing spectacular.
author: Jon L.

description: I'm very picky about sushi being a Southern California native and frequent traveler to japan.    And when I saw this place from the outside, I was hesitant to go in.  The building is old and ugly and the street not that smart.    But once through the front door it was far better.    Excellent service In a small sushi joint.    Highlights where the miso soup, generally something not a highlight food but this is the best miso soups I've ever had and the big rye tuna was very moist and dark red the way it should be.    I found the "great balls of fire" to be avoidable , but the service and overall quality of sushi excellent.
author: Phil B.

description: We very much enjoyed our dinner at Kuma. We arrived early on a Saturday night and it wasn't too busy yet. Everything we had was fresh and tasty. My favorites were the Half Baked, Sweet Potato and Hey Girl rolls. Can't wait to go back again very soon!
author: Ellie M.

description: This was the first time we ate at Kuma. The place was immaculate, the service excellent, the food delicious and fresh. It was worth the wait.  We will certainly be returning!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Great quality food, authentic taste, and they more than made up for the spotty service when we pointed it out. Polish the service and it'll be a hit!
author: Hannah K.

description: Outstanding sushi & saki, great staff willing to give welcomed recommendations, and an overall great atmosphere. 5 stars.
author: J H.

description: The sushi here was very good. I greatly enjoyed the meal and enjoyed the atmosphere. The place is a bit small, so there was bit of a wait. (I went at 8pm on a Saturday night). However, it was worth the wait and I would come back.
author: Robert A.

description: Been there twice and going back - best Sushi experience I've had in many years.  The space is welcoming, kind of industrial but warm, with a great neighborhood feel, and a diverse, lively clientele, The service was perfect, friendly and attentive but never hovering or rushed. The food was amazing!  All this delivered with a smile, for a fair price.  About the food - that was the best part!  An artful treat composed to satisfy all the senses - nuanced, subtle. Try to eat slowly so you can appreciate it!   Everything I've tried was delicious great, but I especially loved the Anago - local saltwater eel, specially prepared, never had it before [and I'm a huge Unagi fan - come meet its saltwater cousin!]; other winners for me: Osuimono, a clear soup based on stock from the days fresh fish bones with shitake, tofu and kelp - really great!  I have to recommend the Kuma Roll too, it was delicious.and like everything else beautifully prepared and kindly presented.  My friends loved the Sake, but it's not my thing - I ordered a rose, to my delight it paired beautifully with my meal as well. The whole experience was so well thought out, doubtless because the chefs are the owners, have decades of experience making sushi, and it shows! I've seen Polk Street evolve over the last 30 years, Kuma is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.  I would give the place ten stars if I could!
author: David D.
